snippet: In two early stage studies, Bristol-Myers Squibb’s nivolumab and Merck’s pembrolizumab shrank tumors in patients with Hodgkin’s lymphoma.
abstract: Research published online by New England Journal of Medicine Researchers finds that drugs that free body’s immune system to fight cancer, known as PD-1 inhibitors, have shown strong preliminary results in treating Hodgkin’s lymphoma, shrinking tumors in well over half of patients who have exhausted many other treatment options.
lead_paragraph: In two early stage studies, Bristol-Myers Squibb’s nivolumab and Merck’s pembrolizumab shrank tumors in patients with Hodgkin’s lymphoma.

headline.main: Cancer Drugs That Free Brake on Immune System Show Promise for Hodgkin’s
headline.print_headline: Cancer Drugs That Free Brake on Immune System Show Promise for Hodgkin’s
